intro: Hieracium italicum, commonly known as Italian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous root system. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
